comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: this would be after the summer of 1912 when her bridge ventilators were replaced with the new style

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
March 6, 1914, according to Bain's date, scratched on the glass negative.

Returning from Baseball's round-the-world tour:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5051564664/]

The world tour participants were tendered a sumptuous homecoming banquet:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/boston_public_library/2350719344/]

The history by Ted Sullivan was published in 1914. Google Books had digitized it, but it is not yet available for reading online.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/baseballart/133860706/]
In booklet form, Sullivan's history sold for a quarter:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/baseballart/5005469376/]

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: nudecowboy and Wystan:  Thanks for the information and the date on the negative.

comment.author: 11031539@N00
comment._content: Christy Mathewson and Jim Thorpe were on that tour, among others: books.google.com/books?id=xT-4K5jYlwgC&printsec=front...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
The baseball teams in Egypt:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/uicdigital/4787862018/in/photostream/]
And in Japan:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5517543916/in/photostream/]
They amused the King of England, George V:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/boston_public_library/2349876523/]

Chicago White Sox players enjoy R & R in NYC, after return from the world tour:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4998803026/]
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5051562912/]

comment.author: 39525591@N03
comment._content: If you want to read about this unique and exciting tour read my book The Tour to End All Tours: The Story of Major League Baseball's 1913-1914 World Tour published by the University of Nebraska Press in 2004. It puts all these pictures in context.
